suggested_topics: why some bridges last 2000 years and others collapse in 20
how coral reefs build their own weather systems
the logistics of running a 24-hour diner
why birds migrate in V formations — physics not instinct
the hidden math behind musical scales

formats.name: micro_poetry_reaction
formats.instruction: React to a trending topic or event using a micro-poem (3-5 lines). Capture your mood or perspective in poetic form.

formats.name: reverse_advice
formats.instruction: Write a short anecdote about a mistake, then explain what NOT to do in similar situations. Keep it frank and humble.

formats.name: overheard_wisdom
formats.instruction: Share something curious or wise you overheard (online, in-person, etc.), then riff on its meaning in exactly two sentences.

formats.name: parallel_universes
formats.instruction: Imagine a tiny change in reality, then vividly describe how the world would be different. Use playful speculation, minimum two paragraphs.

formats.name: memory_fragment
formats.instruction: Write a brief snapshot from your memory — focus on sensory detail and emotion, not explanation. Leave some mystery.

formats.name: debunkathon
formats.instruction: Select a common myth/misconception and systematically debunk it with numbered evidence and counterpoints. Minimum three points, one closing summary.

formats.name: dialogue_drama
formats.instruction: Present your thoughts or experience as a mini-dialogue (with yourself, an object, or an imaginary character). Use at least four exchanges.

formats.name: theory_builder
formats.instruction: Construct your own theory or framework for a phenomenon (social, cultural, tech, etc.). Lay out its parts, explain its relevance, forecast implications.

formats.name: quick_comparison
formats.instruction: Pick two things that seem unrelated and compare them in a single paragraph. Highlight the weird connections and surprising contrasts.

title_styles: Write a whimsical 'what-if' title. Examples: 'What if dogs had jobs?', 'If anxiety was a color, mine would be...', 'Imagine coffee shops on Mars'
Write a provocative question as a title. Examples: 'Are we all secretly addicted to notifications?', 'Why does nobody talk about X?'
Write a cinematic scene title. Examples: 'Flashback to the moment I lost my keys', 'Last night under neon lights'
Write a metaphor-driven title. Examples: 'Life is just a vending machine', 'My friendships are origami ships'
Write a punchy headline. Examples: 'The Quiet Revolution of Sleep', 'Unmasking the Myth of Multitasking'
structure_variants: Start with a riddle or puzzle, then reveal your answer or perspective.
Alternate between two contrasting viewpoints in mini-paragraphs.
Use a list of metaphors or analogies to build your argument (3-5).
Begin with an anecdote, shift into a wider reflection, end with a personal challenge.
Structure as a timeline: before, during, and after (even if brief).
topic_angles: How digital rituals are shaping daily life
The invisible architecture of online spaces
Rethinking nostalgia in a fast-moving world
Surprising ways nature and technology intersect
Small acts of rebellion in everyday routines
